question: A ligand which has two different donor atoms and either of the two ligates with the central metal atom/ion in the complex is called
explanation: Any ligand which has two different donor atoms and only one atom can ligate with the metal at a time is called an ambidentate ligand (e.g., <katex>$NO_2^-$</katex>, <katex>$SCN^-$</katex>).
